description: In this series the viewer will be introduced to terms and the concepts related to one digital presence today on the Internet. The viewer will learn about online concepts such as WiFi, email, web browsers and how to utilize them, digital ethics, citizenship and more.
name: IC3 Living Online
subtitle: Global Standard 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes help us to understand how to get connected to the internet and use the browser as a basic tool for access websites and web pages and searching for information.  They show how to use the address bar using a URL and using search engines when we do not know the exact URL needed to get access to a web page.  Wes also explains how to get connected through an ISP-internet service provider and how to effectively use the browser tools, such as zoom, favorites and even the history.
episodes.title: Internet, Navigation and Web Browsing

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes take a look at some of the different licensing concepts that users will encounter when dealing with content on the internet.  They stress the ideal that not all content that is available on the internet is there for any use that the user deems fit but must be used according to and respect the licensing of the content.  They review some of the most common types of license:  Creative Commons License (CCL), Fair Use, Public Domain and GPL.  All different licensing models should be understood by citizens of the internet in the digital age, according the team.
episodes.title: Licensing

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes take a look at working with email.  They show how to use an email client, the etiquette used and email management.  Each of these are important parts of living online in a business setting or personal setting according to the guys.  They emphasize the use of messages, attachments and how to send and check for emails.  Also discussed by the guys is the etiquette when sending emails too.
episodes.title: Email Clients

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes discuss working with calendars and using social media.   They start by show how a calendar system works and emphasizes it’s usability.  They demonstrate creating not only events but also creating appointments and even sharing calendars.  Lastly, they also talk about the nature of digital identities as an online reputation and cyberbullying activities to be aware of what can happen with social media if not careful with your personal information while living online.
episodes.title: Calendaring and Social Media

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the online world of communications, conferencing, and streaming. They begin by looking at common communications tools like email, blogs, VoIP, and social networking. Then they jump into conferencing, discussing the advantages of video conferencing with options like screen sharing. Finally, they go over streaming services; explaining concepts like bandwidth, buffering, and data rates.
episodes.title: Communications, Conferencing and Streaming

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes discuss digital principles and ethics. They begin by looking at the 9 principles to follow when creating and interacting with computer programs, all the while touching on the different ethics that govern the citizens of the online world.
episodes.title: Digital Principles and Ethics
